subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: nuff said?
author: April Abercrombie
full_text:
Uh oh Frank!!!!!

Just teasin' ;)

> >
> > Frank,
> >
> > Long before I began recording they where talking to me out loud too & you

> this it is what it is!
> >
> > Andrea
> > ----- Original Message -----

> > Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] nuff said?
> >
> >
> >
> >
> > I know what it is, even though I can't even spell it or pronounce it.
> It's what the skeptics and debunkers tout as the answer to all paranormal
> experience. I think we ought to pull our claws back in, especially me!
> >
> > I have gotten "voices" that I thought were perfectly clear, and no one
> else could hear it, and some I found was just a snippet of music, so yeah,
> that happens, but it does not eliminate or explain everything from the
> boxes, and other EVP methods, you just have to be aware of the possibility.
> Anotherr problem is broadcast fragments, sometimes they are just what they
> sound like, an ad for one thing or another, sometimes they can have
> sychronistic meaning, and sometimes they can be altered in some way to form
> a messages, such as the recent one I had about learning sex, which was
> seemingly ignored by all cuz it has the "s" word--I guess. The fragments can
> also be distorted as the radio tuning is swept across a station, I don't
> accept every word and syllable as meaning something. You have tio judge
> mnessage by content and personal meaning.
> >
> > I have seen faces stand up in a carpet right in front of me, not
> something I just happened across, something that happened live as I watched.
> For someone to suggest that's imagination I find very offensive.
> >
> > When I first switched to a linear sweep in the boxes, I could hear
> nothing but gibberish, then suddenly I could hear "them" speaking. I doubt
> that is all imagination either, I think the mind(which is not brain) has to
> reprogram the ears, which are brain, to hear. I also think the skeptics can
> not allow this programming to take place, hence they can't hear. I would be
> very surprised if any of the hard core skeptics even turned on a box for
> fear that they may hear something that's not there. Rorke(the Phd) implied
> as much when he wanted a box to test, or more like debunk. That crap is
> frikkin' pathetic!
> >
> >
> >
> >
> > F-S
> >
> >
> >
> >
> > On Fri, Apr 23, 2010 at 4:30 PM, April Abercrombie <april@...> wrote:
> >
> >
> > Pareidolia is not psuedo science. It is an actual, proven, natural
> functioning of the brain.
> >
> > http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pareidolia
> >
> > Please read this article, and more, if you have any questions about it
> being psuedo science. I chose the Wikipedia version because I thought it
> would be the least offensive to you. Other articles specifically called out
> EVP and other things.
> >
> > For the record, I don't think all EVP's are due to pareidolia.
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> > On Fri, Apr 23, 2010 at 3:47 PM, Frank Sumption <purplealiengirl@...>
> wrote:
> >
> >
> >
> > It was implied that all this stuff is "Pareidolia", and because you could
> put a name on it that somehow meant it was all explanined. I've been hearing
> this pseudo scientific BS for 10 years, so I'm a bit touchy. Science
> explains the paranormal away, and yet people continune to photograph images,
> and get their names, and the names of deseased loved ones through EVP, as
> well as questions answered, and science(althogh not all scientists) just
> ignores these inconvinient facts and focuses on that we might see things
> that are not there, which I disagree with as well.
> >
> > Did you even bother looking at the image on the group home page. That was
> from sweeping a TV tuner with a random voltage and video recording the
> monitor screen. So explain away why there is a wolf image embedded in the
> guy's hat, an image of an alien below his ear, and why in God's name does he
> resembles the classic description of an MIB or Shadow Person? Pareidolia no
> doubt!
> >
> > F-S
> >
> >
> > On Fri, Apr 23, 2010 at 3:19 PM, Rj <rasterer@...> wrote:
> >
> >
> >
> > I'm not sure who you're talking to about "holier than thou". But, you are
> the one who keeps dismissing any question about results and testing with
> phrases like "Bite Me". I don't see anyone else doing that, and I certainly
> never have.
> >
> > I agree trying new things is good. And discussing results. And looking
> for new directions. So I'm still not sure who you are upset with. Perhaps
> you could be more specific: quote what you have found objectionable, and let
> us know why?
> >
> >
> >
> > --- On Fri, 4/23/10, Frank Sumption <purplealiengirl@...> wrote:
> >
> >
> > From: Frank Sumption <purplealiengirl@...>
> > Subject: [EVP-ITC] nuff said?

> > "Congratulations! bulletbabea has changed your membership status for the

> >
> > Go ahead skepdorks, make my day! I don't mind some honest debate, but not
> this holier than thou science BS, where you think cuz you stick a label on
> something it can be dismissed as thoroughly debunked. Maybe--I'm easily
> offended, and I'll take that into account.
> >
> > F-S
> >
>
>
